Tenth Ave., east side, north from West 21st Street and showing at 23rd Street a portion of that major residential improvement known as London or Chelaa Terrace,erected on the block bounded by 23rd and 24th Streets, east fgom Tenth to Ninth Aves. Upon same, stood the original and aubsequent Mbore homes; this individual being the former owner of
most of the area depicted in this view.
January 15, 1938.

733458f-b.title: Transportation - Railroads - New York Central Railroad - Trains.
733458f-b.text:
Transportation: The N. Y. C. R. R.'s trains on Tenth Avenue at W. 21st and 25th Streets. The former point is where the new R. C. Church of the Guardian Angel stands. Through the cooperation of the City and the R. R. Co. this traffic hazzard was removed in 1932, oulminating years of study and effort. An elevated roadbed that continuss into an open Cut is now utilised. This work was a major part of the West Side Improvement Project. See files under that classification
and the various thoroughfares.
View 11 August 4, 1938
View 2: About 1931
View 3: About 1931
P. L. Sperr
